column4: Is there a way to restart sound in lucid when it boots without it working?
I thought I had tried that... I'll give it a shot, though.
Did that work? Otherwise I can offer more assistance.
Are you using PulseAudio?
Yes.
In terminal, type in 'killall pulseaudio'. Then press Alt+F2 and type in 'pulseaudio'.
That doesn't need sudo?
killall shouldn't.
That didn't work, either.
What are you trying to play audio from?
Hm... can you hear audio from any other programs?
No idea.  .. like what?
Try a YouTube video, see if that works.
nope.
Hm.. I used to have an issue when I was programming in Java, that if Java used sound, it destroyed my sound until I rebooted. Have you used any Java applications?
Not on purpose.
I could not tell you what the problem is then. Sorry storm_zen. But it could be an older hardware issue, since you said that you have had this issue for three years.

perhaps.  It if is, though, then it happened with a fairly new Intel board ( at the time ), with the onboard sound, and then with the Turtle Beach soundcard that I bought to get around the 'new unsupported hardware' problem...
Thanks for your attention.  I guess I'll just reboot now.
Sorry again. It actually might be an issue with the actually application also.
It could be hogging all of the audio, and then crashing your card.
If that were the case, then it happens before I purposely run anything requiring sound.
Don't know what to say. Good luck though.
Night, and good luck.
